entities.name: lord voldemort
entities.description: Lord Voldemort is described as the greatest wizard of all time and the most powerful. He is also mentioned as the killer of Dumbledore and other men.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as one of Lord Voldemort's victims.

entities.name: the boy
entities.description: The boy is described as the one who has destroyed one of Lord Voldemort's Horcruxes.

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Although not explicitly mentioned by name, it can be inferred that Harry Potter is the 'boy' referred to in the text.

entities.name: goblin's corpse
entities.description: The goblin's corpse is mentioned as something Lord Voldemort kicks aside while pacing the room.

entities.name: hagwarts
entities.description: Hogwarts is mentioned as one of the places that Lord Voldemort thinks might be a Horcrux.

relationships.description: The boy has destroyed one of Lord Voldemort's Horcruxes, which suggests that he is a target of attack for Lord Voldemort.
Lord Voldemort thinks Hogwarts might be one of his remaining Horcruxes.
The boy has destroyed one of Lord Voldemort's Horcruxes.
